intro: Nicotiana cirrhoides, commonly known as the silverleaf tobacco, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It produces capsule fruits containing numerous small, black seeds. Nicotiana cirrhoides is also notable for its role in ecological interactions, including pollination by various insects and birds.
